Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Patricia Malcolm, Interim Chair of CUSH (Churches United to Save & Heal) 711 E. 78th St.  Brooklyn, N.Y. 11236.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Maisel.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Council Member Rev. Fernando Cabrera on behalf of Rev. Patricia Malcolm, Interim Chair of CUSH (Churches United to Save & Heal) 711 East 78th Street, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11236.

On behalf of Council Member Maisel, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of January 18, 2017 be adopted as printed by Council Member Van Bramer.
Items.MinutesNote: On behalf of Council Member Van Bramer, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of January 18, 2017 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices

Communication from the Board of Elections - Submitting the Certification of Election of Bill Perkins, as the new Council Member of the 9th Councilmanic District,  Manhattan.

THE CITY CLERK AND CLERK OF THE COUNCIL PERFORMS THE FORMAL CEREMONY OF THE ELECTED COUNCIL MEMBER BILL PERKINS TAKING HIS OATH OF OFFICE.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Bill Perkins, as the new Council Member of the 9th Councilmanic District, Manhattan County.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to designating expanded polystyrene as recyclable and repealing sections 16-324(f) and 16-329 of the administrative code of the city of New York
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Designating expanded polystyrene as recyclable and repealing sections 16-324(f) and 16-329 of the administrative code of the city of NY.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring all NYPD officers to receive sensitivity training to assist them in responding to victims of gender-based street harassment and sexual assault
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring all NYPD officers to receive sensitivity training to assist them in responding to victims of gender-based street harassment and sexual assault

Items.Title: Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating comprehensive reporting and oversight of NYPD surveillance technologies
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Creating comprehensive reporting and oversight of NYPD surveillance technologies.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring landlords leasing commercial space for certain uses to provide to the tenant a certificate of occupancy and to disclose any liens, fines, or encumbrances that affect title, use or physical condition of the property or the interest of the lessee
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Economic Development
Items.MatterName: Requiring landlords leasing commercial space for certain uses to provide to the tenant a certificate of occupancy and to disclose any liens, fines, or encumbrances that affect title, use or physical condition of the property or the interest of the lessee.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the map and explanatory text relating to city facilities to be updated annually
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Fair Share - Requiring the map and explanatory text relating to city facilities to be updated annually.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring a study of the city’s fair share criteria every five years
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Fair Share - Requiring a study of the city’s fair share criteria every five years.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to an owner’s duty to purchase and install radiator covers
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Owner’s duty to purchase and install radiator covers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the New York city charter in relation to signage in privately owned public spaces
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Signage in privately owned public spaces.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to report information on school applications, offers of admission, enrollment and school seats available
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring the DOE to report information on school applications, offers of admission, enrollment and school seats available.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to penalties for violations of conditions and restrictions on privately owned public spaces
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Penalties for violations of conditions and restrictions on privately owned public spaces.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to improving public information about concentrated siting of city facilities
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Fair Share - Improving public information about concentrated siting of city facilities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to reducing overconcentration of city facilities in certain community districts
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Fair Share - Reducing overconcentration of city facilities in certain community districts.

Items.Title: Resolution approving changes in Membership to certain Standing Committees, Subcommittee and Chair.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Approving changes in Membership to certain Standing Committees, Subcommittee and Chair.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to creating an online posting requirement for statements outlining consistency or inconsistency with criteria established for the siting of city facilities
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Fair Share - Creating an online posting requirement for statements outlining consistency or inconsistency with criteria established for the siting of city facilities.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation to create a uniform process for community notification and local input on the siting of any state or state-authorized facility in the city of New York and to review the distribution of such facilities already in place
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Fair Share - Create a uniform process for community notification and local input on the siting of any state or state-authorized facility in the city of NY and to review the distribution of such facilities already in place.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to improving community access to information about the siting of city facilities
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Fair Share - Improving community access to information about the siting of city facilities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to including additional capital projects in the citywide statement of needs
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Fair Share - Including additional capital projects in the citywide statement of needs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to creating an interactive online mapping tool of facilities required to be mapped in conjunction with the citywide statement of needs
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Fair Share - Creating an interactive online mapping tool of facilities required to be mapped in conjunction with the citywide statement of needs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to reporting on certain domestic violence initiatives
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women's Issues
Items.MatterName: Reporting on certain domestic violence initiatives.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to report on students in temporary housing
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring the DOE to report on students in temporary housing.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring an office or agency designated by the mayor to provide outreach and education regarding the earned income disallowance benefit to eligible public housing tenants and eligible tenants of other housing programs
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Housing
Items.MatterName: Requiring an office or agency designated by the mayor to provide outreach and education regarding the earned income disallowance benefit to eligible public housing tenants and eligible tenants of other housing programs.

Items.MatterName: Calling upon President Donald Trump to fully fund the Institute of Museum and Library Services, and to not diminish or eliminate the agency in any form.

Items.MinutesNote:
The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. James).

There were 48 Council Members marked present at this Stated Meeting following the ceremonial swearing-in of Council Member Bill Perkins during the Communication from City, County & Borough Offices segment of this Meeting.

Items.Title: Application No. 20175151 TCM pursuant to Section 20-226 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York, concerning the petition of 26th Street Hospitality Group LLC,, d/b/a Bread & Tulips, for a revocable consent to establish, maintain and operate an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 365 Park Avenue S, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board 5, Council District 2. This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and Section 20-226 of the New York City Administrative Code.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk café, BREAD & TULIPS, 365 Park Ave S, Manhattan (20175151 TCM)

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito), the Public Advocate (Ms. James) adjourned to meet again on Thursday, March 16, 2017.

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
The Public Advocate (Ms. James)  put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

Int No. 873-A,  47-1-0 (Negative: CM Gentile)

See files for individual votes.
The City Clerk and Clerk of the Council (Mr. McSweeney) performed the formal ceremony of swearing-in Bill Perkins as the new Council Member of the 9th Council District (Manhattan).

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.
